fields_of_interest: Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Circular Economy, Construction Products Regulation, Ecodesign Directive, Ecolabelling framework, Energy Efficiency Directive, Energy Performance of Buildings Directive, Energy Union, European Waste Policy, F Gas Regulation, REACH, Sustainable building
organisation_name: Federation of European Rigid Polyurethane Foam Associations (PU Europe)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Consultation Forum according to Art. 23 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014 on fluorinated greenhouse gases#X03338#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3338#Member#C
membership:
PU Europe has established partnerships with several related European organisations with a view to jointly promoting specific topics and avoiding duplication. 
 
- CPE (Construction Products Europe) 
- EA ETICS 
- EuroACE (European Alliance for Companies for Energy Efficiency in buildings) 
- The Coalition for energy savings 
- The Modern Building Alliance 
     
In standardisation bodies: PU Europe has established liaison status with: 
-    CEN/CENELEC Energy Management Sector Forum 
-    CEN/TC 88 
-    CEN/TC 89 
-    CEN/TC 127 
-    CEN/TC 128 
-    CEN/TC 350 
-    CEN/TC 351 
-    ISO/TC 59/ SC17
goals__remit:
PU Europe  represents the polyurethane (PUR/PIR) insulation industry in Europe. It: 
1 Develops one-voice positions on technical, safety, health and environment, standardisation and communication topics 
2 Funds and coordinates studies and research programmes 
3 Acts as information hub for its members and the wider public
relevant_communication: Position papers, Press releases, Factsheets on specific issues, Participation to thematic events
